data.description: These cookies are chewy, sweet and delicious. Perfect for serving at any happy occasion.
data.ingredients:
1 cup softened butter
1 cup white sugar
1 cup light brown sugar
2 tsp vanilla extract
2 large eggs
3 cups flour
1 tsp baking soda
0.5 tsp baking powder
1 tsp salt
2 cups chocolate chips

photos.description: Preheat oven to 375F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a medium bowl, mix together the flour, baking soda, salt and baking powder. Set aside.
Cream together butter and sugars until combined. Beat in the eggs and vanilla.
Mix the dry ingredients in until combined Mix in the chocolate.
Roll into balls of dough and space evenly on the cookie sheets.
Bake for about 10 minutes or until they are just starting to brown.
Let them sit on the baking pan for 2 minutes before removing to cooling rack.

data.description: This delicious dinner is a surefire winner in my house. Filled with hearty, homemade goodness.
data.ingredients:
1 package lasagna noodles
3/4 pound ground beef
1 medium onion, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced
2 cans crushed tomatoes
2 cans tomato paste
2/3 cup water
2 to 3 tablespoons sugar
1/4 cup minced fresh parsley
2 teaspoons dried basil
3/4 teaspoon salt
1 egg, beaten

photos.description: Cook noodles according to directions on package and drain.
Cook the onion and beef over medium heat until meat browns.
Add garlic, stir in tomatoes, tomato paste, water, sugar, parsley, salt and pepper; bring to a boil.
Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
In a small bowl, mix egg and cheese. Preheat oven to 375Â°F and spread 2 cups of meat sauce into a baking dish.
Layer with 3 noodles and 1/3 of the cheese mixture. Sprinkle with mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses. Repeat layers twice. Top with remaining meat sauce and cheeses.
Bake covered for 25 minutes, or until bubbly. Let stand 15 minutes before serving.
